relation: Allow selecting desktop / optional components at install (KDE/Gnome/XFCE4/Development/Games/Etc)
Update Software Manager to allow changing optional components on the fly
Create GUI front-end to new PBI9 format files / pbi-manager
Allow file-system selection when doing auto-partitioning.
Merge keyboard layout / timezone / language into single installer page
Don't make "free space" a selectable option during install, require user to create partition first
Convert all remaining apps which use KDE API to pure QT4 only.
Allow specifying the hostname for installed system via the GUI
Provide option in network manager to disable lagg0 device
Create new PC-BSD® specific configuration GUI, which provides access to all other config tools, ala system-settings
Create 9.0 Handbook and include offline version with release
pageTitle: Difference between revisions of "PC-BSD® 9.0 TODO" - PC-BSD Wiki
textBeforeTable: Base System Software The following items are features or bugs that we wish to get fixed and into PC-BSD® 9.0: PC-BSD® 9.0 is due to be released a day or so after FreeBSD 9.0 Release. The current release schedule for FreeBSD 9.0 is available on the FreeBSD 9.0 Release Engineering TODO Wiki. PC-BSD® 9.0 Task List 2.3.3 PC-BSD® Bugs 2.3.2 Window Manager Bugs 2.3.1 FreeBSD Bugs 2.3 Reporting Bugs 2.2 Network / Internet installation 2.1 Getting the Snapshots 2 PC-BSD® 9.0 Snapshots 1.5 Getting Involved 1.4 New Features / Tools we would like to see in 9.0 1.3 New Features / Tools planned for 9.0 1.2 Bug Fixes 1.1 Base System Software 1 PC-BSD® 9.0 Task List Contents PC-BSD® 9.0 TODOProtection (edit): Edited by: Tigersharke Revision as of 16:17, 25 August 2012
textAfterTable: DONE Geli set passphrase via CLI jpaetzel DONE Touchscreen drivers mav / kmoore DONE New Features / Tools we would like to see in 9.0 BlueTooth Manager GUI This project would be to develop a QT4 based GUI, which acts as a front-end to the FreeBSD BlueTooth configurations, such as /etc/bluetooth/hcsecd.conf FreeBSD BlueTooth Handbook Dial-Up Tethering GUI This project would be to develop a QT4 based GUI, which acts as a front-end to the ppp.conf file, and allow dial-up / tethering configurations to be done graphically. Getting Involved Find something you want to help with on this list, or perhaps something you have something new to contribute? If so, first take a look at the Developers Page and then get in touch with us on the PC-BSD® Developers Mailing List PC-BSD® 9.0 Snapshots Every few weeks or so, we are releasing updated "snapshots" of PC-BSD® 9, based upon the latest FreeBSD 9-CURRENT. The technical minded, or simply the brave are welcome to download and test these releases. Getting the Snapshots The current snapshots are available for download from the PC-BSD® FTP server: ftp://ftp.pcbsd.org/pub/snapshots The snapshots
